I was a user of Lowe's project card untill a week ago. Without reason or cause on my part the account was closed....

I found it redundant considering the fact their business is so slow many of their employees are having to quit due to lack of work hours... Home Depot appreciates stupidity like that considering they pick up more business that way. I will pay off my small balance and move on none worse for the experience. I will gladly tell all about the treatment one recieves in doing business with such a business....

I guess some companies would be better off if the were out-sourced to another country. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year to all that read this......

Company wrote 0 public responses to the review from Dec 18, 2009.

I had a consumer credit card and just paid the balance IN FULL the end of December. Now I received a letter telling me they CLOSED my account.

I've been making my monthly payments on time and just decided to pay off the full balance.

Why would they do that? It makes absolutely no sense to me.

Mascotbridge Pty Ltd Testimonial

By February 21, 2017Testimonials

Dale Edwards has been my personal accountant and trusted business advisor for several years. During this time, Leon and the Advivo team, has helped me and my wife manage the bookkeeping and finances of my business, Mascotbridge Pty Ltd.

What I appreciate most about Advivo is the added value they provide. For example, they offer free seminars that are aimed at exposing different ways of thinking and managing a business. I just recently attended a seminar that had speakers who discussed the importance of developing a business transition plan and the way to begin the process.

I found this seminar very helpful as it gave me the confidence I needed to proceed with developing a transition plan. I learnt that there are logical processes you can take to exit a business and it does not have to be left to the last minute. Essentially, Advivo has made this entire process more manageable and approachable.

Dale introduced Leon and we are now in the beginning stage of developing a transition plan for my business. I am very impressed with the process thus far as Advivo’s approach is sensible and logical. I am already seeing positive outcomes in terms of sourcing a potential buyer and revaluing the business’s assets.

As a whole, I am very impressed with Advivo’s wide ranging services. They are not just a one stop shop, the team will always go the extra mile to ensure you and your business are on the right to path to success.

The Entrepreneur Club: Early March New Year Networking Event Review

By March 6, 2018 Business

Myself and my colleague, Ruby, attended the Entrepreneur Club: Early March New Year Networking Event on Thursday the 1st of March. The event was a meet up for professional individuals who are on their journey to achieving their entrepreneurial goals. It was organised to allow new entrepreneurs to connect with people on the same journey and share their stories.

The event was located at Spice Market in Collins Street. The venue was not the most suitable location, the lighting was very dim, there were not enough seats and the small area that the event was contained in made it awkward for people not currently in conversations to join existing ones.

Most of the people who attended were currently in-between jobs and were looking for positions. The rest of the crowd either worked in or owned a small business. Most people that myself and Ruby spoke to had an entrepreneurial idea that they wanted to develop in the future.

The event and conversations we had with the attendees taught us that there are many people with great ideas for start-ups that just require consulting to turn their light bulb moments into real and practical steps.

I would not re-attend this event. Although it was interesting to meet a diverse range of people, I did not enjoy the location, there was no food provided and I do not believe there was a synergy between the individuals.


Things of note:

  • Location: Spice Market
  • Highlight: Meeting new people
  • Cost: Free
  • Hot Tip: Eat beforehand!



  • Venue: 1 / 5
  • Catering: 0 / 5
  • Speaker: 0 / 5
  • Networking Opportunity: 1 / 5

Total: 2 / 20


Megan Nolan

Complaint Review: Prestige Financial

  • Submitted: Mon, January 07, 2008
  • Updated: Mon, January 07, 2008

  • Reported By:Phoenix Arizona
Prestige Financial
1420 S 500 West Salt Lake City, Utah U.S.A.
  • Phone: 801-844-2100
  • Web:
  • Category: Loans

Prestige Financial Turned down by several car companies and ripped off at buy-here, pay here,you take what's offered. Salt Lake City Utah

SEO Reputation Management at its best!

When you have been turned down by several car dealers and ripped off by a buy-here, pay here dealer, you don't have many alternatives. That's why I made a deal for a newer car with Prestige Financial, even though logic told me 20+% and a service agreement of $3000 tacked on to the loan didn't seem that appealing. The used car payments now total almost $20,000. The payment seemed fairly reasonable, which I thought I could live with. But, I lost the good job I had after several months & could not make the payments. They were okay with it the first month, but when I got two months behind they started to make threatening comments. My assets are nil and income is now only $1500/month, yet they want to garnish a % of my wages(more than the payment), even though I have offered to surrender the car to them. They've already made several thousand dollars in interest on the loan.
I found out from someone with many years in the car business that these banks that do substandard loans always get full retail for the car and tack on as much as they can to get their money rapidly out of the loan. They have already made more off me and my loan than they would from some rich guy. There ought to be a law against charging excessive interest to someone who is trying to recover from financial difficulty, yet they just pile on as much as legally possible. I have checked with several dealers who tell me I owe several thousand more than the car is worth, so I am stuck either way.

Phoenix, Arizona

This report was posted on Ripoff Report on 01/07/2008 02:18 PM and is a permanent record located here: http://www.ripoffreport.com/r/Prestige-Financial/Salt-Lake-City-Utah-84115/Prestige-Financial-Turned-down-by-several-car-companies-and-ripped-off-at-buy-here-pay-he-297805. We needed shirts with our company name – Fred’s Used Websites – embroidered on them. Jennifer found shirts that met our criteria from the vast selection of possibilities. Then we received an e-mailed mock-up of what the embroidered font would look like, and gave our approval.

The next thing I knew the shirts were ready!
